name: 2D Auto Layout
description:
Make auto layout adaptive! This plugin moves elements to the next row if they overflow a frame, saving you a ton of time of moving them manually.


A 2D Auto Layout frame consists of:

  1. Container: A parent frame with a vertical auto layout.
  2. Rows: Child frames with a horizontal auto layout. Rows can contain elements of any type.


Run 2D Auto Layout:

  1. Select a 2D Auto Layout frame.
  2. Change the width of this frame to your liking.
  3. Use the command “Run” to automatically rearrange the items.
  4. After you have used "Run" on a frame once, you can also use the button "Run 2D Auto Layout" in the design panel.


Create a 2D Auto Layout from selected elements:

  1. Select elements (which have the same parent frame).
  2. Use “Create from selection” to create a 2D Auto Layout from the selection.
  3. Et Voilà.
  4. Change the width of the frame to your liking and use “Run” to rearrange the items (or click the button "Run 2D Auto Layout" in the design panel).


Change the layout to columns (instead of rows):

  1. Select a 2D Auto Layout frame.
  2. User “Switch layout mode” and select “columns”.
  3. Now the container has a horizontal layout mode and the rows (which are now columns) have a vertical layout mode.
  4. Change the height of the frame to your liking and use “Run” to rearrange the items.
